title: VPTESTNMB/VPTESTNMW/VPTESTNMD/VPTESTNMQ â€” Logical NAND and Set

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VPTESTNMB k2 {k1}, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VPTESTNMB k2 {k1}, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VPTESTNMB k2 {k1}, zmm2, zmm3/m512`
`VPTESTNMW k2 {k1}, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VPTESTNMW k2 {k1}, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VPTESTNMW k2 {k1}, zmm2, zmm3/m512`
`VPTESTNMD k2 {k1}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m32bcst`
`VPTESTNMD k2 {k1}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m32bcst`
`VPTESTNMD k2 {k1}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m32bcst`
`VPTESTNMQ k2 {k1}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m64bcst`
`VPTESTNMQ k2 {k1}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m64bcst`
`VPTESTNMQ k2 {k1}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m64bcst`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Performs a bitwise logical NAND operation on the byte/word/doubleword/quadword element of the first source operand (the second operand) with the corresponding element of the second source operand (the third operand) and stores the logical comparison result into each bit of the destination operand (the first operand) according to the writemask k1. Each bit of the result is set to 1 if the bitwise AND of the corresponding elements of the first and second src operands is zero; otherwise it is set to 0.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded VPTESTNMD/Q: The first source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM registers. The second source operand can be a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location, or a 512/256/128-bit vector broadcasted from a 32/64-bit memory location. The destination is updated according to the writemask.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded VPTESTNMB/W: The first source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM registers. The second source operand can be a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location. The destination is updated according to the writemask.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
